column4: So nobody knows what the specific command to show the desktop?
Istarnes, I think there would have to be wouldnt there, given the "Show Desktop" icon, and Ctrl alt d
someone posted it already: ctl-alt-d
and as I told them, I need the /command/ not the keybind
are you talking about a command to give the shell to show your desktop?
exactly
Istarnes, well, then I could always set the icon to execute a shell script to do that
Its just docky doesnt seem to like gnome-applets
you would be looking for some gnome control
any idea what or where it might be?
I dont suppose theres a way to search for key bindings either?
key bindings are in your system menu
exactly where would that be
and Istarnes, I know that, I need to figure out what script it executes or whatever it does to show the desktop
Istarnes, well it has to do it somehow, and whatever way it does it, a gnome-applet uses the same trigger, which is what I need to find
Istarnes, I'm trying to put the show/hide desktop icon into docky, but it wont allow me to just put the gnome-applet in there
Also, could I get some help with Empathy? It doesnt seem to want to support anything But XMPP Protocols
apparently you want to use wmctrl
thanks
this script worked for me to minimize all windows
here's the link: http://episteme.arstechnica.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/96509133/m/346009106631
